name: DN1210-010 ITP Landscaping & Urban design
template name: DN1210-010 ITP Landscaping & Urban design Rev 1

name: SECTION 1 – MATERIAL, PERSONNEL & THIRD PARTY APPROVAL

Detail - The Contractor shall submit the construction and QA methodology, for each element of Wetland & Landscaping including, testing, inspection and hold points for review and approval prior to works.
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Prior to Earthworks
Detail - Permeability value of bentosure liner
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - permeability value of 1 × 10⁻⁹ m/s
Standard / Specification - Refer to installation guide
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Once per source - prior to commencement of works
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Class D geotextile fabric
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Once prior to commencement of works
Detail - Testing of on-site and imported topsoil for quality.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Topsoil must meet the criteria specified in the project standards.
Standard / Specification - NZTA P39: 2013, Section F
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Once per source
Detail - Verify that the mulch used meets the specified criteria (e.g., pallet mulch, arborist mulch).
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Mulch material should be free of contaminants, sufficiently aged, and appropriate to site and slope conditions
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - 100% of mulch used
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - 450 GSM, 7mm thick, biodegradeable weed mat
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Once prior to commencement of works
Detail - D50=150mm Grading Approval D50=250mm Grading Approval
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Once prior to commencement of works
Detail - Weathering Index of Coarse Aggregate
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - AA to CA
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - 1 per 1000m3
Detail - Crushing Resistance of Course Aggregate
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - 1 per 1000m3
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - >2.65 tonnes per m3
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - 1 per 1000m3
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - 1 per 1000m3
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - 1 per 1000m3
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Send seed mix to engineer for approval
Standard / Specification - NZTA P39: 2013, Section F
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Once prior to commencement of works
Detail - Confirm that the site has been marked out according to the project plans and specifications before construction begins.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Contractor shall provide written notice to the Engineer, at least two days prior to Setting out.
Verifying Document - Setting Out Notice Report
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Before each stage
Detail - Grading for planting areas to ensure drainage.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Smooth, flowing contours with proper drainage.
Standard / Specification - NZTA P39: 2013, Section G PS 16.6.3
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - 100% of areas
Detail - Excavation of tree pits according to specified dimensions.
PLANT SIZE (LITRE / PB) || NO. OF STAKES || TREE PIT SIZE
LESS THAN 15LT/ PB28 || 1 || 2X SIZE OF ROOT BALL
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Per tree pit
Detail - Correct staking and tree placement as per plan and specifications

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Newly planted specimen trees shall be staked with two 50 x 50 x 1.8m rough sawn Pine H4 treated or hardwood stakes with at least one third of their length (600mm) in the ground and at least 1.0m exposed minimum, or as specified on the plan with the approval of the Overseeing Organisation.
Standard / Specification - NZTA P39: 2013, Section G
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Each Tree
Detail - Timber stakes used for landscaping must be of specified type, treated to prevent decay, and meet size and quality requirements.
PLANT SIZE (LITRE / PB) || NO. OF STAKES || TREE PIT SIZE
LESS THAN 15LT / PB28 || 1 || 2X SIZE OF ROOT BALL
Standard / Specification - NZTA P39: 2013, Section I
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Per order
Detail - All plantings shall have two-year slow-release fertilizer tablets installed at the time of planting.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Fertiliser tablet placed in bottom of hole before planting. Fertiliser composition: 6:15:3 (N:P:K). Up to 14l is 1 tab, 45l is 4 tabs
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Each Area
Detail - Correct mulch application on flat sites

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - On sites flatter than a 1:3 grade (1.0m high by 3.0m metres long), mulch shall be spread evenly to a depth of 80-100mm after settlement, over the planted area, creating an inverted cone hollow around each plant stem with a maximum 25mm depth around plant stems.
Standard / Specification - NZTA P39: 2013, Section G
Verifying Document - Site Records / As Built Survey
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Each Area
Detail - inspect before installing bentosure liner

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Ensure subgrade is smooth, compacted, and free of sharp objects, debris. Confirm BentoSure rolls are delivered intact, labeled, and stored properly (off the ground, covered). Confirm panel layout plan and anchor trench dimensions are per specifications.
Standard / Specification - Refer to installation guide
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - For all liner areas
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - 600mm Deep/400mm wide Anchorage key in footing
Standard / Specification - Refer to installation guide
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - For all liner
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Longitude 300mm/Latitude 500mm overlaps minimum
Standard / Specification - Refer to installation guide
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Each Area
Detail - Post inspection - after bentosure has been laid and before any topsoil is placed on top

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Verify panels lie flat without wrinkles or folds.Check seam overlaps Inspect anchor trench dimensions and proper backfilling.Confirm cover soil is free of sharp objects and is at least 300mm thick.Inspect for tears, punctures, or wrinkles; repair as needed with 300mm overlap and bentonite application.
Standard / Specification - Refer to installation guide
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - For all liner areas
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - 600mm Deep/400mm wide Anchorage key in footing
Standard / Specification - Refer to installation guide
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - For all liner
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - On slopes steeper than 1:3 biodegradeable matting shall over lap 100mm between adjacent rolls and 500mm longitudinally
Standard / Specification - NZTA P39: 2013, Section G
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Each Area
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - On slopes steeper than 1:3 edges shall be keyed in to topsoil 150mm x 150mm
Standard / Specification - NZTA P39: 2013, Section G
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Each Area
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - On slopes steeper than 1:3 biodegradeable matting shall be pinned with frequency of 2 per m2 min.
Standard / Specification - NZTA P39: 2013, Section G
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Each Area
Detail - Apply grass seed as soon as practical after area is prepped. Protect newly established grass areas.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Newly established grass shall be protected from damage by pedestrian and vehicular traffic until grass has reached a self-sustaining state. Newly grassed areas shall be maintained with regular mowing (90mm-30mm) ensuring that all clippings are removed from adjacent hard surfaces.
Standard / Specification - NZTA P39: 2013, Section G
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Each Area
SECTION 3 – POST CONSTRUCTION (FINAL INSPECTION AND HANDOVER)
Detail - As-Built records and drawings shall accurately record the layout and extents of all the work.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Record of work completed
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - During Earthworks
Client Final Inspection - the signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the Specifications and verifies lot compliance.
